page.title: 08Transport Marton BIrdingbury
page.content: A railway line runs through Marton and Birdingbury.In bygone days barges and railways were used before the car became popular.For a long time the railway was the only means of trans_ port.The bus service was introduced to the villages in the late forties.With the increase in popularity of the car, the use of the railway and bus service diminished.The railway line was finally closed down 30 years ago.The bus service is now just one a day. Children are carried to school on a school bus or in a car.The local population now feel that to live in a village one needs to have the use of a car.
